00083 /*
00084 *********************************************************************************************************
00085 *                                        GetTaskONEParm
00086 *
00087 * Description: This is a helper function used to extract arguments from a string. 
00088 *
00089 * Arguments  : cmd - a null-terminated string.
00090 *              val - a pointer to where the extracted the value is placed.
00091 *
00092 * Returns    : a 8-bit error code.
00093 *
00094 * Note(s)    :
00095 *********************************************************************************************************
00096 */
00097 static INT8U GetTaskONEParm(char* cmd, INT8U *Val)
00098 {
00099    char *token;
00100    INT8U err = OK;
00101    INT8U tokenCount  = 0;         
00102    
00103    while (1)
00104    {    
00105       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
00106   
00107       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
00108         break;
00109 
00110       switch (tokenCount)
00111       {         
00112          case 0:                          /* Command name */
00113                         *Val = atoi ( token ); 
00114             break;
00115 
00116          default:
00117             err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00118             continue;
00119           }
00120       
00121       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
00122       /* Get the next token */
00123    }
00124 
00125    if (tokenCount != 1)                  /* If there were enough arguments then return */
00126         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00127 
00128    return err;
00129 }
00130 
00131 /*$PAGE*/
00132 /*
00133 *********************************************************************************************************
00134 *                                        mystrtok
00135 *
00136 * Description: Lite version of strtok.
00137 *
00138 * Arguments  : str - a pointer null terminated string.
00139 *              delim  - a ASCII character that is delimter
00140 *
00141 * Returns    : a pointer to a token.
00142 *
00143 * Note(s)    :
00144 *********************************************************************************************************
00145 */
00146 char *mystrtok(char* str, char delim)
00147 {
00148    static char *ptr;
00149    char *tmp;
00150    char *result;
00151    
00152    /* If string specified is not null, 
00153     *  then set this string as our default
00154     *  working string. 
00155     */
00156    if (str)
00157       ptr = str;
00158 
00159    /* Eat up all delimiter at the start of a string */
00160    while (*ptr == delim)
00161       ptr++;
00162 
00163    /* Is this an empty string? */
00164    if (*ptr == '\0')
00165       return NULL;
00166 
00167    /* Now we know we have a valid character so lets mark this point as start */
00168    tmp = ptr;
00169    while (*tmp && *tmp != delim)
00170       tmp++;
00171 
00172    /* either we have found the delimeter or null. 
00173     * If its a delimiter then set the pointer after the 
00174     * delimiter for next time. 
00175     */
00176    result = ptr;
00177    if (*tmp)
00178       ptr = tmp+1;
00179    else
00180       ptr = tmp;
00181 
00182    *tmp = '\0';
00183    return result;
00184 }

00188 *********************************************************************************************************
00189 *                                        GetTCB
00190 *
00191 * Description: This function prints out the complete task list.
00192 *
00193 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
00194 *
00195 * Returns    : an error code
00196 *
00197 * Note(s)    :
00198 *********************************************************************************************************
00199 */
00200 INT8U GetTCB( char *cmdArgs )
00201 {
00202 
00203    char *token;
00204    INT8U    i;
00205    OS_TCB  *ptcbPtr;
00206    ptcbPtr = &OSTCBTbl[0];
00207    INT8U err = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00208    
00209    token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
00210    if ( token == NULL)          /* There should no more tokens */
00211    {
00212       err  = OK;
00213       SerialPutString("Task Control Blocks\r\n");
00214 
00215        SerialPutString("\r\n There are ");
00216        SerialPutDecNum((OS_MAX_TASKS + OS_N_SYS_TASKS - 1)); 
00217        SerialPutString(" task allocated\r\n"); 
00218          
00219             for (i = 0; i < (OS_MAX_TASKS + OS_N_SYS_TASKS - 1); i++) {  /* Init. list of free TCBs            */
00220         
00221                     SerialPutDecNum((i+1));
00222                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBStkSize: ");
00223                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBStkSize);
00224                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBOpt: ");
00225                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBOpt);
00226                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBNext: ");
00227                     SerialPutDecNum((INT16U)ptcbPtr->OSTCBNext);
00228                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBPrev: ");            
00229                     SerialPutDecNum((INT16U)ptcbPtr->OSTCBPrev);
00230                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBEventPtr: ");
00231                     SerialPutDecNum((INT16U) ptcbPtr->OSTCBEventPtr);
00232                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBMsg: ");
00233                     SerialPutDecNum((INT16U) ptcbPtr->OSTCBMsg);
00234                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBId: ");
00235                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBId);
00236                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBDly: ");
00237                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBDly);
00238                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBStat: ");
00239                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBStat);
00240                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBPrio: ");
00241                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBPrio);
00242                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBX: ");
00243                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBX);
00244                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBY: ");
00245                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBY);
00246                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBBitx: ");
00247                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBBitX);
00248                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBBitY: ");
00249                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBBitY);
00250                     SerialPutString("\r\n OSTCBDelReq: ");
00251                     SerialPutDecNum(ptcbPtr->OSTCBDelReq);
00252                     SerialPutString("\r\n");
00253                     ptcbPtr++;
00254             }
00255    }
00256 
00257    return err;
00258 }

00463 /*
00464 *********************************************************************************************************
00465 *                                        TimeDelay
00466 *
00467 * Description: This function supports the timedelay command. This function needs a time parameters. 
00468 *
00469 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
00470 *
00471 * Returns    : an error code
00472 *
00473 * Note(s)    :
00474 *********************************************************************************************************
00475 */
00476 INT8U TimeDelay( char *cmdArgs)
00477 { 
00478    INT8U hours = 0;
00479    INT8U minutes = 0;
00480    INT8U seconds = 0;
00481    INT16U milli = 0;
00482    INT8U err = OK;
00483    INT8U tokenCount  = 0;
00484    char *token;
00485    
00486    while (1)
00487    {    
00488       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
00489   
00490       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
00491         break;
00492 
00493       switch (tokenCount)
00494       {         
00495          case 0:                          /* Command name */
00496                         hours = atoi ( token ); 
00497             break;
00498 
00499          case 1: 
00500                         minutes = atoi ( token ); 
00501             break;
00502 
00503          case 2: 
00504                         seconds = atoi ( token ); 
00505             break;
00506 
00507          case 3:
00508                         milli = atoi ( token ); 
00509             break;
00510 
00511              default:
00512             err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00513             continue;
00514           }
00515       
00516       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
00517       /* Get the next token */
00518    }
00519 
00520    if ( (err == OK) && (tokenCount == 4) )                  /* If there were enough arguments then return */
00521    {        
00522         err = OSTimeDlyHMSM(hours, minutes, seconds, milli);
00523         if (err != OS_NO_ERR)
00524             SerialPutString("OSTimeDlyHMSM failed\r\n");  
00525 
00526         err = OK;   
00527    }
00528    
00529    return err; 
00530 }

00534 *********************************************************************************************************
00535 *                                        GetTime
00536 *
00537 * Description: This function gets system tick count. 
00538 * 
00539 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
00540 *
00541 * Returns    : an error code
00542 *
00543 * Note(s)    :
00544 *********************************************************************************************************
00545 */
00546 INT8U GetTime( char *cmdArgs){ 
00547    char *token;
00548    INT8U err = OK;
00549    
00550    token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
00551   
00552    if ( token != NULL)          /* If there no more tokens then get out */
00553         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00554    else
00555    {
00556         SerialPutString("Tick Count: ");
00557         SerialPutDecNum(OSTimeGet());
00558         SerialPutString("\r\n");        
00559    }
00560    
00561    return err;
00562 }

00565 /*
00566 *********************************************************************************************************
00567 *                                        SetTime
00568 *
00569 * Description: This function sets system tick count. 
00570 * 
00571 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
00572 *
00573 * Returns    : an error code
00574 *
00575 * Note(s)    :
00576 *********************************************************************************************************
00577 */
00578 INT8U SetTime( char *cmdArgs){ 
00579    char *token;
00580    INT8U err = OK;
00581    INT32U tickCount = 0;
00582    INT8U tokenCount  = 0;  
00583 
00584    while (1)
00585    {    
00586       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
00587   
00588       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
00589         break;
00590 
00591       switch (tokenCount)
00592       {         
00593          case 0:                          /* Command name */
00594                         tickCount = atoi ( token ); 
00595             break;
00596 
00597          default:
00598             err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00599             continue;
00600           }
00601       
00602       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
00603       /* Get the next token */
00604    }
00605 
00606    if (tokenCount != 1)                  /* If there were enough arguments then return */
00607         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00608    else
00609    {
00610         OSTimeSet(tickCount);
00611         GetTime( 0 );
00612    }
00613    
00614    return err; 
00615 }

00689 /*$PAGE*/
00690 /*
00691 *********************************************************************************************************
00692 *                                        OSTaskCreateS
00693 *
00694 * Description: This function creates a task. 
00695 * 
00696 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
00697 *
00698 * Returns    : an error code
00699 *
00700 * Note(s)    :
00701 *********************************************************************************************************
00702 */
00703 INT8U OSTaskCreateS( char *cmdArgs ) 
00704 {
00705    INT8U err = OK;
00706    INT8U errOS = OK;
00707    INT8U priority = 0;
00708    INT8U place = 0;   
00709    
00710    err = GetTaskONEParm(cmdArgs, &priority);
00711    if (err == OK)
00712    {
00713         if(TaskCnt == MAX_SHELL_TASKS)
00714         {
00715             SerialPutString("Total Task limit reached\r\n");
00716         }
00717         else
00718         {
00719                         while ( (TaskPrio[place] != 0xff) && (place != MAX_SHELL_TASKS) ) 
00720                      place++;
00721                         
00722             errOS = OSTaskCreate(ShellTasksFunction, (void *)0,
00723                        &SHELL_TSK_STK[place][SHELL_TSK_SIZE - 1], priority);
00724             if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
00725             {
00726                 SerialPutString("Task Created\r\n");              
00727                 TaskPrio[place] = priority;
00728                 TaskCnt++;
00729             }
00730             else
00731             {
00732                            TaskPrio[place] = 0xff;
00733                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
00734                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
00735                SerialPutString("\r\n");
00736             }
00737         }            
00738    }
00739    
00740    return err; 
00741 }
00742 
00743 /*$PAGE*/
00744 /*
00745 *********************************************************************************************************
00746 *                                        OSTaskDeleteS
00747 *
00748 * Description: This function deletes a task. If the task deleted is one of the task created with the shell
00749 *              a resources are freed. a task. 
00750 * 
00751 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
00752 *
00753 * Returns    : an error code
00754 *
00755 * Note(s)    :
00756 *********************************************************************************************************
00757 */
00758 INT8U  OSTaskDeleteS( char *cmdArgs )
00759 {
00760    INT8U err = OK;
00761    INT8U errOS = OK;
00762    INT8U priority = 0;
00763    INT8U index = 0;
00764    
00765    err = GetTaskONEParm(cmdArgs, &priority);
00766    if (err == OK)
00767    {
00768         errOS = OSTaskDel(priority);
00769         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
00770         {
00771                 SerialPutString("Task Deleted\r\n");
00772 
00773                 for (index = 0; index < TaskCnt; index++)
00774                 {
00775                     if( priority == TaskPrio[index])  /* If the task we just deleted was a shell task, then decrease the count */
00776                     {
00777                         TaskPrio[index] = 0xFF; 
00778                         TaskCnt--;                 
00779                     }
00780                 }
00781         }
00782         else
00783         {
00784                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
00785                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
00786                SerialPutString("\r\n");
00787         }
00788    }
00789    
00790    return err; 
00791 }
00792 
00793 /*$PAGE*/

00796 *                                        OSTaskSuspendS

00805 *********************************************************************************************************

00807 INT8U OSTaskSuspendS( char *cmdArgs )

00809

00816    {

00818         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
00819         {
00820                 SerialPutString("Task Suspended\r\n");
00821         }
00822         else
00823         {
00824                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
00825                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
00826                SerialPutString("\r\n");
00827         }
00828    }
00829    return err; 
00830 }

00870 /*$PAGE*/
00871 /*
00872 *********************************************************************************************************
00873 *                                        OSSemphoreCreateS
00874 *
00875 * Description: This function creates a task. 
00876 * 
00877 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
00878 *
00879 * Returns    : an error code
00880 *
00881 * Note(s)    :
00882 *********************************************************************************************************
00883 */
00884 INT8U OSSemphoreCreateS( char *cmdArgs )
00885 {
00886 #if (OS_SEM_EN > 0)
00887    INT8U err = OK;
00888    INT16U count = 0;
00889    INT8U place = 0;
00890 
00891    err = GetTaskONEParm(cmdArgs, (INT8U*) &count);
00892    if (err == OK)
00893    {
00894         if(SempCnt == MAX_SHELL_SEMPS)
00895         {
00896             SerialPutString("Total Semaphore limit reached\r\n");
00897         }
00898         else
00899         {
00900             while ( (ShellSempList[place] != 0) && (place != MAX_SHELL_SEMPS) ) 
00901                place++;       
00902         
00903             ShellSempList[place] = OSSemCreate(count);
00904             if (ShellSempList[SempCnt] != OSEventFreeList)
00905             {
00906                 SerialPutString("Semaphore Created\r\n");
00907                 SempCnt++;
00908             }
00909             else
00910             {
00911                ShellSempList[place] = 0;
00912                SerialPutString("ECB is full. \r\n");
00913             }
00914         }            
00915    }
00916    return err; 
00917 #else
00918     SerialPutString("OS_SEM_EN is 0\r\n");
00919     return OK
00920 #endif 
00921 }
00922 
00923 /*$PAGE*/
00924 /*
00925 *********************************************************************************************************
00926 *                                        OSSemphoreDeleteS
00927 *
00928 * Description: This function deletes a semaphore. 
00929 * 
00930 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
00931 *
00932 * Returns    : an error code
00933 *
00934 * Note(s)    :
00935 *********************************************************************************************************
00936 */
00937 INT8U  OSSemphoreDeleteS( char *cmdArgs )
00938 {
00939 #if (OS_SEM_EN > 0)
00940 #if (OS_SEM_DEL_EN > 0)
00941 #if (OS_MAX_EVENTS > 0)
00942    INT8U index = 0, tokenCount= 0;
00943    INT8U errOS, err = OK;
00944    INT8U ECBNumber = 0, opt = 0;
00945    OS_EVENT  *pevent;
00946    char *token;
00947    
00948    while (1)
00949    {    
00950       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
00951   
00952       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
00953         break;
00954 
00955       switch (tokenCount)
00956       {         
00957          case 0:                          /* Command name */
00958                         ECBNumber = atoi ( token ); 
00959             break;
00960 
00961          case 1: 
00962                         opt = atoi ( token ); 
00963             break;
00964 
00965          default: 
00966                         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00967             continue;
00968           }
00969       
00970       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
00971       /* Get the next token */
00972    }
00973 
00974 
00975    if (tokenCount != 2)
00976         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
00977 
00978    if (err == OK)                  
00979    {   
00980         pevent = &OSEventTbl[ECBNumber];
00981         OSSemDel(pevent, opt, &errOS);
00982         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
00983         {
00984                 SerialPutString("Semaphore Deleted\r\n");
00985                 for (index = 0; (index < MAX_SHELL_SEMPS && SempCnt); index++)
00986                 {
00987                     if( pevent == ShellSempList[index])  /* If the semaphore we just deleted that was  */
00988                     {                                   /* created by the shell, we will restore the resources. */
00989                         ShellSempList[index] = (OS_EVENT*)0; 
00990                         SempCnt--;              
00991                         break;                        
00992                     }
00993                 }
00994         }
00995         else
00996         {
00997                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
00998                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
00999                SerialPutString("\r\n");
01000         }
01001    }   
01002    return err; 
01003 #else
01004     SerialPutString("OS_MAX_EVENTS is 0\r\n");
01005     return  OK; 
01006 #endif
01007 #else
01008     SerialPutString("OS_SEM_DEL_EN is not enabled\r\n");
01009     return  OK; 
01010 #endif
01011 #else
01012     SerialPutString("OS_SEM_EN is 0\r\n");
01013     return OK
01014 #endif 
01015 }
01016 
01017 /*$PAGE*/
01018 /*
01019 *********************************************************************************************************
01020 *                                        OSSemphorePendS
01021 *
01022 * Description: This function pends a semaphore. 
01023 * 
01024 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
01025 *
01026 * Returns    : an error code
01027 *
01028 * Note(s)    :
01029 *********************************************************************************************************
01030 */
01031 INT8U OSSemphorePendS( char *cmdArgs )
01032 {
01033 #if (OS_SEM_EN > 0)
01034    INT8U tokenCount= 0;
01035    INT8U errOS, err = OK;
01036    INT8U ECBNumber = 0, timeout = 0;
01037    OS_EVENT  *pevent;
01038    char *token;
01039    
01040    while (1)
01041    {    
01042       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
01043   
01044       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
01045         break;
01046 
01047       switch (tokenCount)
01048       {         
01049          case 0:                          /* Command name */
01050                         ECBNumber = atoi ( token ); 
01051             break;
01052 
01053          case 1: 
01054                         timeout = atoi ( token ); 
01055             break;
01056 
01057          default: 
01058                         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01059             continue;
01060           }
01061       
01062       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
01063       /* Get the next token */
01064    }
01065 
01066    if (tokenCount != 2)
01067         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01068 
01069    if (err == OK)                  /* If there were enough arguments then return */
01070    {   
01071         pevent = &OSEventTbl[ECBNumber];
01072         OSSemPend(pevent, timeout, &errOS);
01073         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
01074         {
01075                 SerialPutString("Semaphore Pended\r\n");
01076         }
01077         else
01078         {
01079                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
01080                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
01081                SerialPutString("\r\n");
01082         }
01083    }
01084    
01085    return err;
01086 #else
01087     SerialPutString("OS_SEM_EN is 0\r\n");
01088     return OK
01089 #endif 
01090 }
01091

01163         {
01164             SerialPutString("Total Mutex limit Exceed\r\n");

01167         {
01168 
01169                         while ( (ShellMutexList[place] != 0) && (place != MAX_SHELL_MUTEXS) )

01173             if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)

01176                 MutexCnt++;
01177             }
01178             else
01179             {
01180                    ShellMutexList[place] = 0;
01181                    SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
01182                    SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
01183                    SerialPutString("\r\n");
01184             }
01185         }            
01186    }
01187    return err; 
01188 #else
01189     SerialPutString("OS_MUTEX_EN is 0\r\n");
01190     return OK;
01191 #endif 
01192 }

01360                         timeout = atoi ( token ); 
01361             break;

01399 /*
01400 *********************************************************************************************************
01401 *                                        OSFlagCreateS
01402 *
01403 * Description: This function creates a flag group.
01404 * 
01405 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
01406 *
01407 * Returns    : an error code
01408 *
01409 * Note(s)    :
01410 *********************************************************************************************************
01411 */
01412 INT8U OSFlagCreateS( char *cmdArgs )
01413 {
01414 #if (OS_FLAG_EN > 0)
01415    INT8U err = OK;
01416    INT8U errOS; 
01417    INT16U flags = 0;
01418    INT8U place = 0;
01419 
01420    err = GetTaskONEParm(cmdArgs, (INT8U*) &flags);
01421    if (err == OK)
01422    {
01423         if(FlagGrpCnt == MAX_SHELL_FLAGGRPS)
01424         {
01425             SerialPutString("Total flag group limit reached\r\n");
01426         }
01427         else
01428         {
01429 
01430                    while ( (ShellFlagGroupList[place] != 0) && (place != MAX_SHELL_FLAGGRPS) ) 
01431                place++;
01432 
01433             ShellFlagGroupList[place] = OSFlagCreate(flags, &errOS);
01434             if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
01435             {
01436                 SerialPutString("Flaggroup Created\r\n");
01437                 FlagGrpCnt++;
01438             }
01439             else
01440             {   
01441                 ShellFlagGroupList[place] = (OS_FLAG_GRP*)0;
01442                 SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
01443                 SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
01444                 SerialPutString("\r\n");
01445             }
01446         }            
01447    }
01448    return err;
01449 
01450 #else
01451     SerialPutString("OS_FLAG_EN is 0\r\n");
01452     return OK;
01453 #endif  
01454 }

01456 /*$PAGE*/
01457 /*
01458 *********************************************************************************************************
01459 *                                        OSFLagDeleteS
01460 *
01461 * Description: This function deletes a flag group.
01462 * 
01463 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
01464 *
01465 * Returns    : an error code
01466 *
01467 * Note(s)    :
01468 *********************************************************************************************************
01469 */
01470 INT8U OSFLagDeleteS( char *cmdArgs )
01471 {
01472 #if (OS_FLAG_EN > 0)
01473 #if (OS_FLAG_DEL_EN > 0)
01474 
01475    INT8U index = 0;
01476    INT8U tokenCount= 0;
01477    INT8U errOS, err = OK;
01478    INT8U flagGrpNumber = 0, opt = 0;
01479    OS_FLAG_GRP  *pevent;
01480    char *token;
01481    
01482    while (1)
01483    {    
01484       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */  
01485       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
01486         break;
01487 
01488       switch (tokenCount)
01489       {         
01490          case 0:                          /* Command name */
01491                         flagGrpNumber = atoi ( token ); 
01492             break;
01493 
01494          case 1: 
01495                         opt = atoi ( token ); 
01496             break;
01497 
01498          default: 
01499                         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01500             continue;
01501           }
01502       
01503       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
01504       /* Get the next token */
01505    }
01506 
01507    if (tokenCount != 2)
01508         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01509 
01510    if (err == OK)                  /* If there were enough arguments then return */
01511    {   
01512         pevent = &OSFlagTbl[0];
01513         OSFlagDel(pevent, opt, &errOS);
01514         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
01515         {
01516                 SerialPutString("Flag group Deleted\r\n");
01517                 for (index = 0; (index < MAX_SHELL_FLAGGRPS && FlagGrpCnt); index++)
01518                 {
01519                     if( pevent == ShellFlagGroupList[index])                     
01520                     {
01521                         ShellFlagGroupList[index] = (OS_FLAG_GRP*)0; 
01522                         FlagGrpCnt--;
01523                         break;                 
01524                     }
01525                 }
01526         }
01527         else
01528         {
01529                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
01530                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
01531                SerialPutString("\r\n");
01532         }
01533    }   
01534    return err;
01535 #else
01536     SerialPutString("OS_FLAG_DEL_EN is disabled. \r\n");
01537     return OK;
01538 #endif
01539 #else
01540     SerialPutString("OS_MUTEX_EN is 0. \r\n");
01541     return OK;
01542 #endif
01543 }
01544 
01545 /*$PAGE*/
01546 /*
01547 *********************************************************************************************************
01548 *                                        OSFlagPostS
01549 *
01550 * Description: This function posts on a flag group.
01551 * 
01552 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
01553 *
01554 * Returns    : an error code
01555 *
01556 * Note(s)    :
01557 *********************************************************************************************************
01558 */
01559 INT8U OSFlagPostS( char *cmdArgs )
01560 {
01561 #if (OS_FLAG_EN > 0)
01562    INT8U flagGrpNumber = 0;
01563    INT16U flags = 0;
01564    INT8U opt = 0;
01565    INT8U err = OK;
01566    INT8U tokenCount  = 0;
01567    INT8U errOS = OK;
01568    OS_FLAG_GRP  *pevent;
01569    
01570    while (1)
01571    {    
01572       cmdArgs = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
01573   
01574       if ( (cmdArgs == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
01575         break;
01576 
01577       switch (tokenCount)
01578       {         
01579          case 0:                          /* Command name */
01580                         flagGrpNumber = atoi ( cmdArgs ); 
01581             break;
01582 
01583          case 1: 
01584                         flags = atoi ( cmdArgs ); 
01585             break;
01586 
01587          case 2: 
01588                         opt = atoi ( cmdArgs ); 
01589             break;
01590 
01591          default:
01592             err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01593             continue;
01594           }
01595       
01596       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
01597    }
01598 
01599    if (tokenCount != 3)
01600         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01601 
01602    if (err == OK)
01603    {
01604         pevent = &OSFlagTbl[flagGrpNumber];
01605         OSFlagPost(pevent, flags, opt, &err);
01606         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
01607         {
01608               SerialPutString("Flaggroup posted.\r\n");
01609         }
01610         else
01611         {
01612                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
01613                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
01614                SerialPutString("\r\n");
01615         }
01616    }
01617    return err;
01618 #else
01619     SerialPutString("OS_FLAG_EN is 0\r\n");
01620     return OK;
01621 #endif
01622 }
01623 
01624 /*$PAGE*/
01625 /*
01626 *********************************************************************************************************
01627 *                                        OSFlagPendS
01628 *
01629 * Description: This function pends on a flag group.
01630 * 
01631 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
01632 *
01633 * Returns    : an error code
01634 *
01635 * Note(s)    :
01636 *********************************************************************************************************
01637 */
01638 INT8U OSFlagPendS( char *cmdArgs )
01639 {
01640 #if (OS_FLAG_EN > 0)
01641    INT8U flagGrpNumber = 0;
01642    INT16U flags = 0;
01643    INT8U waitType = 0;
01644    INT16U timeout = 0;
01645    INT8U err = OK;
01646    INT8U tokenCount  = 0;
01647    INT8U errOS = OK;
01648    OS_FLAG_GRP  *pevent;
01649    
01650    while (1)
01651    {    
01652       cmdArgs = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
01653   
01654       if ( (cmdArgs == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
01655         break;
01656 
01657       switch (tokenCount)
01658       {         
01659          case 0:                          /* Command name */
01660                         flagGrpNumber = atoi ( cmdArgs ); 
01661             break;
01662 
01663          case 1: 
01664                         flags = atoi ( cmdArgs ); 
01665             break;
01666 
01667          case 2: 
01668                         waitType = atoi ( cmdArgs ); 
01669             break;
01670 
01671          case 3: 
01672                         timeout = atoi ( cmdArgs ); 
01673             break;
01674 
01675          default:
01676             err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01677             continue;
01678           }
01679       
01680       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
01681    }
01682 
01683    if (tokenCount != 4)
01684         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01685 
01686    if (err == OK)
01687    {
01688         pevent = &OSFlagTbl[flagGrpNumber];
01689         OSFlagPend(pevent, flags, waitType, timeout, &err);
01690         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
01691         {
01692               SerialPutString("Flaggroup pended.\r\n");
01693         }
01694         else
01695         {
01696                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
01697                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
01698                SerialPutString("\r\n");
01699         }
01700    }
01701    return err;
01702 #else
01703     SerialPutString("OS_FLAG_EN is 0\r\n");
01704     return OK;
01705 #endif
01706 }
01707 
01708 /*$PAGE*/
01709 /*
01710 *********************************************************************************************************
01711 *                                        OSMailBoxCreateS
01712 *
01713 * Description: This function creates a mailbox.
01714 * 
01715 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
01716 *
01717 * Returns    : an error code
01718 *
01719 * Note(s)    :
01720 *********************************************************************************************************
01721 */
01722 INT8U  OSMailBoxCreateS( char *cmdArgs )
01723 {
01724 #if (OS_MBOX_EN > 0)
01725    INT8U tokenCount= 0;
01726    INT8U place = 0;
01727    INT8U err = OK;
01728    char *msg = 0; 
01729    char *token;
01730    
01731    while (1)
01732    {    
01733       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
01734   
01735       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
01736         break;
01737 
01738       switch (tokenCount)
01739       {         
01740          case 0:                          /* Command name */
01741                         msg = token; 
01742             break;
01743 
01744          default: 
01745                         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01746             continue;
01747           }
01748       
01749       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
01750       /* Get the next token */
01751    }
01752 
01753 
01754    if (tokenCount != 1)
01755         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01756 
01757 
01758    if (err == OK)
01759    {
01760         if(MailboxCnt == MAX_SHELL_MAILBOXS)
01761         {
01762             SerialPutString("Total mailbox limit reached\r\n");
01763         }
01764         else
01765         {
01766 
01767                         while ( (ShellMailBoxList[place] != 0) && (place != MAX_SHELL_MAILBOXS) ) 
01768                place++;
01769             
01770             ShellMailBoxList[place] = OSMboxCreate(msg);
01771             if (ShellMailBoxList[place] != OSEventFreeList)
01772             {
01773                 SerialPutString("MailboxCnt Created\r\n");
01774                 MailboxCnt++;
01775             }
01776             else
01777             {
01778                ShellMailBoxList[place] = 0;
01779                SerialPutString("ECB is full. \r\n");
01780             }
01781         }            
01782    }
01783    return err; 
01784 #else
01785     SerialPutString("OS_MBOX_EN is 0\r\n");
01786     return OK
01787 #endif 
01788 }
01789 
01790 /*$PAGE*/
01791 /*
01792 *********************************************************************************************************
01793 *                                        OSMailBoxDeleteS
01794 *
01795 * Description: This function deletes a mailbox.
01796 * 
01797 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
01798 *
01799 * Returns    : an error code
01800 *
01801 * Note(s)    :
01802 *********************************************************************************************************
01803 */
01804 INT8U  OSMailBoxDeleteS( char *cmdArgs )
01805 {
01806 #if (OS_MBOX_EN > 0)
01807 #if (OS_MBOX_DEL_EN > 0)
01808    INT8U index = 0;
01809    INT8U tokenCount= 0;
01810    INT8U errOS, err = OK;
01811    INT8U ECBNumber = 0, opt = 0;
01812    OS_EVENT  *pevent;
01813    char *token;
01814    
01815    while (1)
01816    {    
01817       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */  
01818       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
01819         break;
01820 
01821       switch (tokenCount)
01822       {         
01823          case 0:                          /* Command name */
01824                         ECBNumber = atoi ( token ); 
01825             break;
01826 
01827          case 1: 
01828                         opt = atoi ( token ); 
01829             break;
01830 
01831          default: 
01832                         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01833             continue;
01834           }
01835       
01836       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
01837       /* Get the next token */
01838    }
01839 
01840 
01841    if (tokenCount != 2)
01842         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
01843 
01844    if (err == OK)                  /* If there were enough arguments then return */
01845    {   
01846         pevent = &OSEventTbl[ECBNumber];
01847         OSMboxDel(pevent, opt, &errOS);
01848         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
01849         {
01850                 SerialPutString("Mailbox Deleted\r\n");
01851                 for (index = 0; (index < MAX_SHELL_MAILBOXS && MailboxCnt); index++)
01852                 {
01853                     if (pevent == ShellMailBoxList[index])  /* If the task we just deleted was a shell task, then decrease the count */
01854                     {
01855                         ShellMailBoxList[index] = (OS_EVENT*)0; 
01856                         MailboxCnt--;
01857                         break;                 
01858                     }
01859                 }
01860         }
01861         else
01862         {
01863                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
01864                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
01865                SerialPutString("\r\n");
01866         }
01867    }
01868    
01869    return err;
01870 #else 
01871     SerialPutString("OS_MBOX_DEL_EN is 0\r\n");
01872     return OK:
01873 #endif
01874 #else
01875     SerialPutString("OS_MBOX_EN is 0\r\n");
01876     return OK:
01877 #endif
01878 }

02066         break;

02110 #else

02121 /*
02122 *********************************************************************************************************
02123 *                                        OSQueueCreateS
02124 *
02125 * Description: This function creates a queue.
02126 * 
02127 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
02128 *
02129 * Returns    : an error code
02130 *
02131 * Note(s)    :
02132 *********************************************************************************************************
02133 */
02134 INT8U OSQueueCreateS( char *cmdArgs )
02135 {
02136 #if (OS_Q_EN > 0)
02137    INT8U err = OK;
02138    INT8U errOS = 0;
02139    INT8U place = 0;
02140 
02141    cmdArgs = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
02142    if ( cmdArgs != NULL)
02143         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;  
02144 
02145    if (err == OK)
02146    {
02147         if(QueueCnt == MAX_SHELL_QUEUES)
02148         {
02149             SerialPutString("Total Queue limit reached\r\n");
02150         }
02151         else
02152         {
02153                         while ( (ShellQueueList[place] != 0) && (place != MAX_SHELL_QUEUES) ) 
02154                place++;              
02155          
02156             ShellQueueList[place] = (OS_EVENT*) OSQCreate(&ShellQueueBuffers[MAX_SHELL_QUEUES][0], QUEUE_SIZE);
02157             if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
02158             {
02159                 SerialPutString("Queue Created\r\n");
02160                 QueueCnt++;
02161             }
02162             else
02163             {   ShellQueueList[place] = 0;
02164                 SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
02165                 SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
02166                 SerialPutString("\r\n");
02167             }
02168         }            
02169    }
02170    return err;
02171 #else 
02172     SerialPutString("OS_Q_EN is 0\r\n");
02173     return OK:
02174 #endif
02175 }
02176

02178 /*
02179 *********************************************************************************************************
02180 *                                        OSQueueDeleteSs

02185 *
02186 * Returns    : an error code
02187 *

02189 *********************************************************************************************************

02197    INT8U tokenCount= 0;
02198    INT8U errOS, err = OK;
02199    INT8U ECBNumber = 0, opt = 0;
02200    OS_EVENT  *pevent;
02201 
02202    char *token;
02203    
02204    while (1)
02205    {    
02206       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */  
02207       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
02208         break;
02209 
02210       switch (tokenCount)
02211       {         
02212          case 0:                          /* Command name */
02213                         ECBNumber = atoi ( token ); 
02214             break;
02215 
02216          case 1: 
02217                         opt = atoi ( token ); 
02218             break;
02219 
02220           default: 
02221                         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
02222             continue;
02223           }
02224       
02225       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
02226       /* Get the next token */
02227    }
02228 
02229    if (tokenCount != 2)
02230         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
02231 
02232    if (err == OK)                  /* If there were enough arguments then return */
02233    {   
02234         pevent = (OS_EVENT*) &OSQTbl[ECBNumber];
02235         OSQDel(pevent, opt, &errOS);
02236         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
02237         {
02238                 SerialPutString("Queue Deleted\r\n");
02239                 for (index = 0; (index < MAX_SHELL_QUEUES && QueueCnt); index++)
02240                 {
02241                     if( pevent == ShellQueueList[index])  /* If the task we just deleted was a shell task, then decrease the count */
02242                     {
02243                         ShellQueueList[QueueCount] = (OS_EVENT*)0; 
02244                         QueueCnt--;
02245                         break;                 
02246                     }
02247                 }
02248         }
02249         else
02250         {
02251                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
02252                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
02253                SerialPutString("\r\n");
02254         }
02255    }
02256    
02257    return err;
02258 #else 
02259     SerialPutString("OS_Q_DEL_EN is 0\r\n");
02260     return OK;
02261 #endif 
02262 #else
02263     SerialPutString("OS_Q_EN is 0\r\n");
02264     return OK;
02265 #endif
02266 }

02268 /*$PAGE*/
02269 /*
02270 *********************************************************************************************************
02271 *                                        OSQueuePostS
02272 *
02273 * Description: This function posts on a queue.
02274 * 
02275 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
02276 *
02277 * Returns    : an error code
02278 *
02279 * Note(s)    :
02280 *********************************************************************************************************
02281 */
02282 INT8U  OSQueuePostS( char *cmdArgs )
02283 { 
02284 #if (OS_Q_EN > 0)
02285 #if (OS_Q_POST_EN > 0) 
02286    INT8U err = OK;
02287    INT8U errOS = OK;
02288    INT8U tokenCount = 0;
02289    INT8U ECBNumber = 0;
02290    OS_EVENT  *pevent;
02291    char* msg = 0;
02292 
02293    while (1)
02294    {    
02295       cmdArgs = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */  
02296       if ( (cmdArgs == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
02297         break;
02298 
02299       switch (tokenCount)
02300       {         
02301          case 0:                          /* Command name */
02302                         ECBNumber = atoi ( cmdArgs ); 
02303             break;
02304 
02305          case 1: 
02306                         msg = cmdArgs; 
02307             break;
02308 
02309           default: 
02310                         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
02311             continue;
02312           }
02313       
02314       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
02315       /* Get the next token */
02316    }
02317 
02318    /* make sure token count is valid */
02319    if (tokenCount != 2)
02320         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
02321 
02322    if (err == OK)
02323    {
02324         pevent = (OS_EVENT*) &OSQTbl[ECBNumber];
02325         errOS = OSQPost(pevent, msg);
02326         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
02327         {
02328               SerialPutString("Queue posted.\r\n");
02329         }
02330         else
02331         {
02332                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
02333                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
02334                SerialPutString("\r\n");
02335         }
02336    }
02337    return err;
02338 #else
02339     SerialPutString("OS_Q_POST_EN is 0\r\n");
02340     return OK;
02341 #endif 
02342 #else
02343     SerialPutString("OS_Q_EN is 0\r\n");
02344     return OK;
02345 #endif
02346 }
02347 
02348 /*$PAGE*/
02349 /*
02350 *********************************************************************************************************
02351 *                                        OSMemoryPendS
02352 *
02353 * Description: This function pends on a queue.
02354 * 
02355 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
02356 *
02357 * Returns    : an error code
02358 *
02359 * Note(s)    :
02360 *********************************************************************************************************
02361 */
02362 INT8U  OSMemoryPendS( char *cmdArgs )
02363 {
02364 #if (OS_Q_EN > 0)
02365    INT8U tokenCount= 0;
02366    INT8U errOS, err = OK;
02367    INT8U ECBNumber = 0, timeout = 0;
02368    OS_EVENT  *pevent;
02369    char *token;
02370    
02371    while (1)
02372    {    
02373       token = mystrtok(NULL, ' '); /* Process the string */
02374   
02375       if ( (token == NULL) || (err != OK) )   /* If there no more tokens then get out */
02376         break;
02377 
02378       switch (tokenCount)
02379       {         
02380          case 0:                          /* Command name */
02381                         ECBNumber = atoi ( token ); 
02382             break;
02383 
02384          case 1: 
02385                         timeout = atoi ( token ); 
02386             break;
02387 
02388          default: 
02389                         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
02390             continue;
02391           }
02392       
02393       tokenCount++;                                              /* Increment the token count */
02394       /* Get the next token */
02395    }
02396 
02397    if (tokenCount != 2)
02398         err  = ILLEGAL_NUMBER_ARGS;
02399 
02400    if (err == OK)                  /* If there were enough arguments then return */
02401    {   
02402         pevent = (OS_EVENT*) &OSQTbl[ECBNumber];
02403         OSQPend(pevent, timeout, &errOS);
02404         if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
02405         {
02406                 SerialPutString("Queue Pended\r\n");
02407         }
02408         else
02409         {
02410                SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
02411                SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
02412                SerialPutString("\r\n");
02413         }
02414    }
02415    
02416    return err;
02417 #else
02418     SerialPutString("OS_Q_EN is 0\r\n");
02419     return OK
02420 #endif 
02421 }
02422

02424 /*
02425 *********************************************************************************************************
02426 *                                        OSMemoryCreateS
02427 *
02428 * Description: This function creates a memory partition.
02429 * 
02430 * Arguments  : cmdArgs - a pointer to null terminated string. 
02431 *
02432 * Returns    : an error code
02433 *
02434 * Note(s)    :
02435 *********************************************************************************************************
02436 */
02437 INT8U OSMemoryCreateS(char *cmdArgs)
02438 {
02439 #if (OS_MEM_EN > 0)
02440    INT8U errOS = OK;
02441    if(MemPartCount == MAX_SHELL_MEMPARTS)
02442    {
02443        SerialPutString("Total Memory parts limit reached\r\n");
02444    }
02445    else
02446    {
02447        ShellMemParts[MemPartCount] = OSMemCreate(MemPart, BLK_NUMBER, BLK_SIZE, &errOS);
02448        if (errOS == OS_NO_ERR)
02449        {
02450            SerialPutString("Memory part created\r\n");
02451            MemPartCount++;
02452        }
02453        else
02454        {
02455           SerialPutString("Operation failed. Errror # ");
02456           SerialPutDecNum(errOS);
02457           SerialPutString("\r\n");
02458        }
02459    }
02460    return OK; 
02461 #else
02462     SerialPutString("OS_MEM_EN not enabled");
02463     return OK;    
02464 #endif 
02465 }
